name: Al Raha Beach Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I spent a week at this hotel at the end of June 08 with my boyfriend. We paid for a Gulf View Room which was definitely worth it otherwise you'd be overlooking the main road. Our room was huge and very luxurious. You really are spoilt in this hotel from the little gifts that are left on your pillow every day to the bottled water, newspapers, fresh fruit and dates that are delivered to your room throughout the week. The bathroom was fantastic with a great shower and an enormous bath which you could lie in and see the sea. The towels were huge and fluffy, bathrobes were supplied along with slippers and flip flops (nice idea) that you could keep. We went half board and its well worth it as the food in the Seville Restaurant was great, with lots of variety of really good quality food.
reviews.title: Gorgeous Hotel
Very nice .....!
reviews.text: Abu Dhabi city is a 20 min ride away but there is a courtesy bus that runs throughout the day. We got the bus in and were the only 2 on it and he took us for a photo stop at the giant mosque.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The shops in the mall are good and the walk to the flag pole is worth it for the views of the city. We had lunch at the Hilton Hotel which was nice and the taxi back to Al Raha was 50 dirhams (about £7).
reviews.title: Too far out of town

likes.liked: — Huge room, excellent service, lovely pool and beach.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There isn't anything to do in the hotel but if you want a relaxing holiday in the sun then this is a good choice. There is live music every evening whilst having dinner and after dinner we chose to have cocktails and a shisha down at the beach bar. Very chilled. There is a nightclub attached to the hotel which we visited once, the drinks are the same price as the hotel and its quite entertaining to watch the locals having fun.
reviews.title: Al Raha Rules!

reviews.text: The pool and the beach are lovely with lots of comfortable beds and towels are provided. There are watersports that you can do and we had a go on the inflatable arm chair which was really fun and quite thrilling and if you had a chance whilst hanging on, it was great to view the hotel from the sea.
reviews.title: wonderful relaxing holiday

reviews.text: Was in Abu Dhabi for a business trip and spent three nights at the Hotel. The lobby and the rooms were overwhelming, in an oriental-classic style, and there is a lush garden. Staff is very friendly. Rooms are extremely large, I had a sea-view room with balcony. There is a coffee-maker in the room, coffee powder and complimentary mineral water is regularly replenished. No ironing board, no slippers. Good flat screen TV with CNN and BBC. Extravagant bathroom with sea-view and all amenities. Bed very comfortable. Breakfast buffet excellent in terms of quality and variety. Some downsides: Service at restaurants including pool side is rather slow, there was noise during the night, it sounded like a kind of drilling machine. The beach is behind a kind of dam that prevents the open sea and circulation of the water, there are no waves, and the underground is somehow swampy. The water temperature was about 40C, but of course the Hotel cannot be blamed. However, the swimming pool was also extremely warm and not really refreshing. To conclude, it was a pleasant stay and I would be happy to return on a next trip.
reviews.title: Nice and comfortable with sea view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Al Raha Hotel is a wonderful place to relax and unwind with family, the staff being very courteous, cleanliness of rooms and bathrooms were perfect, in case of the food we just had the buffet breakfast from the hotel which was again great with healthy menu choices. For those who wish to try other food options they have the Al Raha Mall adjacent to the hotel which provides a variety of Indian, fast food , arabic and mexican food outlets. In addition to these those who wish to indulge in som minor shopping the mall caters to their needs with popular retail and jewellery outlets.
reviews.title: Gr8 Hotel

reviews.text: There is also not much construction around the hotel area which makes a sore sight to eyes, there is no noise so as to disturb the guests present, and also please ask for a sea facing room, the view's just beautiful....
reviews.title: Superb Hotel

reviews.text: The hotel's lobby and room interiors provide a real cool sight to the eyes and mind..
reviews.title: No hot water

reviews.text: We have just returned from a 5 night stay at the Al Raha followed by 4 nights in Dubai, and although our hotel in Dubai was also five star, it just could not be compared to the Al Raha. We knew there would be a lot of construction; that's the way of things in the UAE, and the beach area of the hotel wasn't the best because of that, but that took nothing away from the pure luxury of the hotel, it's opulence and it's wonderful service and facilities. We will definitely be going again. Our room was huge and thoroughly cleaned once a day, and then turned down and smartened up in the evening after we'd taken showers, baths etc. with fruit, chocolates and dates regularly left as well as 'favours' for ladies on the pillow each night, which was lovely. The staff were courteous and friendly. The food was very good in the Sevilla buffet in the evenings, and in the Piscina pool bar and the Azur restaurant. The Mozart in reception for a coffee or pastry was very convenient. Everything was a very high stanard and once the beach area immediately next door is completed, this will be a perfect getaway hotel for a luxurious family treat. Can't wait to go back!
reviews.title: Surrounded by construction

reviews.text: We stayed at the Al Raha for a New Year break of 5 nights. The hotel is overall a delight. Massive spotless bedrooms with nice little gifts on the pillow each evening. Plenty of facilities, gym, squash court, water sports, spa plus the usual beach/pool.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service was at times poor, however i've found no different than other hotels in the region. The staff are very friendly but not very efficient, they make all the right noises but often do not do anything, often resulting in having to make a request many times, which can get a little frustrating

aka: Al Raha Beach Hotel Abu Dhabi
description: Set in landscaped gardens along a stretch of white sandy beach, this palatial hotel is located on the Al Raha corniche. The property offers 254 rooms and suites including the brand new wing furnished with the ultimate in luxury. There are also 24 exclusive villas which have a choice of 2,3 or 4 bedrooms, located in a stunning seafront location adjacent to the main hotel building. The hotel boasts state of the art facilities, including the Body & Soul Spa & Recreation Club complete with temperature controlled outdoor and indoor pools, steam rooms, saunas and Jacuzzis as well as a high tech gymnasium. If variety is the spice of life, dining choices abound from International dishes to exquisite twist of Mediterranean. Al Raha Beach Hotel is a member of the prestigious Preferred Hotels and Resorts Worldwide.
